website_summaries.verdict: Though it's a two-burner model, its features and performance stand up to higher-end models. For consumers on a budget, its grilling abilities, convenience, and sturdy design make it the best choice.
pros: An affordable piece of equipment designed for serious grilling
Offers 20,000 BTUs and 280 square inches of cook space
Side shelves are sturdy and add convenience and value
cons: The main issue with this grill is getting it ready to grill
Users report confusing instructions, missing pieces, and difficulties putting it together

customer_reviews.title: Char- broil classic grill
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Char-Broil Classic 280 2-Burner Gas Grill for my husband as an early Father's Day present. I am so glad I did. He really loves it. So far he's grilled hamburgers, hot dogs, and pork steaks that all turned out amazing. It took him about an hour to put it together. The grate is really easy to clean after use which really made him happy. He uses the different burners to cook different foods on each side and turn one off when necessary. I would highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Portia Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Fire department had to be called!
customer_reviews.text: This afternoon I started up our grill, stepped inside to get the burgers I’d already prepped and plated for grilling, and came back out not two minutes later. Our grill was engulfed in flames, so much that I was unable to safely shut off the propane valve. The fire department was called, and they had to come put out the fire before our house blew up from the full propane tank. Stay far away from this grill!!! Today was a scary experience no one should have to deal with!
customer_reviews.author: Karen from Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Many reviews were saying it was hard to put together. Not the case. Have patience and stay organized and it's very straight forward. Screws come in a package that makes it easy to stay organized (see photo). Grill itself is perfect size for a simple backyard BBQ. Great grill at a great price. Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal and it works perfectly. My 12 year old put it together this morning and we just had a veggie burger, turkey burger, and beef burger (everyone has to have their own thing of course) for lunch. No problems and tastes great!
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Dont waste your money :/ we had a cover on ours only had it a year the inside is rusted and paint is peeling after one year !!!!!! Cleaned after every time we grilled but still.......peeling and rusted. We dont live is crazy climate either had a cover .......total piece of crap
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: To say the least I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: It took forever to put together. But that is to be expected. When I tried to start it. The igniter doesn't work every time. Once start the flame was so high it made the igniter red. To say the least I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Golden

customer_reviews.title: Anyone saying this is easy to put together must work for CHAR-BROIL
customer_reviews.text: It's shocking that a $99 BBQ would come in 4000 parts and require and engineering degree to put together. I'm surprised the barbecue came painted. The first part of the instructions already has holes that do not align and none of the nuts and bolts and many pieces are unmarked. Anyone saying this is easy to put together must work for CHAR-BROIL. I'm sending this back and buying a grill already pre-built. I SHOULD HAVE BORROWED A LARGER CAR AND BOUGHT A GRILL ALREADY ASSEMBLED. DO NOT BUY. TRUST ME
customer_reviews.author: Jonny B

customer_reviews.title: IT HAS COME WITH THE WORST POSSIBLE DIRECTIONS FOR PUTTING TOGETHER THAT I HAVE SEEN ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS GRILL... IT HAS COME WITH THE WORST POSSIBLE DIRECTIONS FOR PUTTING TOGETHER THAT I HAVE SEEN IN 50 YEARS... I AM A COLLEGE GRADE, AND WE ARE NOT TALKING ROCKET SCIENCE HERE, BUT PARTS ARE NOT LABELED, JUST FOR STARTERS... SPENT TWO HOURS ON IT... no more time to waste!!! More than a little irritated...
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: After spending hours to assemble this complicated grill with basic instructions, and also spent $60 for the propane tank. However, I found out that the grill didnt work at all. No gas went thru the burner, no noise, nothing...... so disappointed.... wondering if i can return this thing and get my refund....
customer_reviews.author: Tuan Minh Le

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the neck to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Only giving this 1 star for assembly not for performance. While putting this grill up the whole bolt came off the leg piece leaving a huge hole. Tried getting glue to fix it so that I can screw a nail in. This grill sat on my living room floor for 5 days. I eventually gave up and asked for a refund. I'm glad Amazon was nice enough to take it back and provide me a refund. I drove to Lowe's and got the same grill already assembled. Was $14 more but it saved me the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: Poor purchase on my part
customer_reviews.text: This was a nightmare to assemble. The instructions are terrible. Once I did finally get it assembled it wasn't of a high quality.
customer_reviews.author: peregrine

customer_reviews.title: Kill it and grill it.
customer_reviews.text: I received my grill and started to up pack it, it was packed very well. No dented/ scratched parts. After sorting out the major parts I read through the directions and matched the parts up. Assembly took about 3 hours, the nuts and bolts were in a blister pac/ card with step numbers and amount of pieces to use, very helpful! I’m pleased at how sturdy it is after all the fasteners were tightened. So far all I’ve grilled are sausages, but the grill get plenty hot fast. My only fault with is that there’s no thermometer on the lid, I’ll be adding one soon. So, it’s a good sturdy grill to have.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great last summer. We bought it in July 2018 and used it maybe once a week for two months. Put it in our shed for the winter. Just brought it back out and only one side is working! The other burner won't work. Piece of junk. Wouldn't recommend AT ALL!
customer_reviews.author: SBucha

customer_reviews.title: Great cheaper grill for smaller area
customer_reviews.text: Arrived perfect condition no damage easy to put together ,if your good with tools. if not it will take a little longer. Remember to burn off all the fresh oils and paint before u just throw food on it to cook. Very good cheaper grill. Will Use it daily in warmer weather. My older char broil grill lasted very long but was time to replace it. This is a great similar design but slightly updated ..better in my opinion. Wish it had plastic shelf but oh well it’s just noisey and That’s my only negative point lol happy grilling. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: and it works like the old one
customer_reviews.text: The lower lid (no second level grate) makes grilling large cuts of meat much more concise. I used to have one decades ago, but it finally couldn't be repaired anymore, and nothing was available to replace it, but now I have this "classic", and it works like the old one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Just what i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Not too big but just the right size for my needs, gets good and hot. I like the way the burners are set up 2 rows from front to back. Putting it together was fun by the time I finished I needed a drink. The way the stand is assembled is tricky becauae its not secure until the last bolt is in place kind of like a Japanese Kakuro puzzle.
customer_reviews.author: loosewill

customer_reviews.title: Great cooker.
customer_reviews.text: I know there is a lot of people talking about how hard this is to assemble, My 11 year old daughter did this all by herself in a little under 2 hours and that was even with some breaks. The bit I did see there was nothing abnormal on the assembly that wouldn't be expected. So far I have been very happy with the way it cooks, it has a pretty even heat pattern. The slats in the grill are a little bit farther apart then a standard grill so you have to be careful squashing down on the burgers until they are a little cooked. Overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Cheyne

customer_reviews.title: Faulty engineering - get another product
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately I hired a capable contractor to put this together or it would have been a real disaster The first version of the product was shipped with one piece that had the drill holes in the wrong place The replacement version of the product would not ignite The person I hired to put the grill together had to mix and max parts from the two boxes to finally get the ignition switch to *mostly* work. He also noticed right away that the drill hole was in the wrong place - I may have banged my head against the wall for awhile before realizing it myself Best choose another product from another company in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Telanoff

customer_reviews.title: OK 2 burner, not excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Hmm.. to build it took approximately 2.5-3 hrs from start to finish. Had to watch a few videos on how to build as instructions to parts were slightly confusing. As far as usage goes, great 2 burner for your apartment/condo! As far as cleaning goes, oil kinda gets all over the place as there are air holes throughout the bowl causing to drip onto floor. Beside this, this is an OK 2 burner char-broiler.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ramos

customer_reviews.title: incredibly hard to put together, and i have put together a dozen grills in the last 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Every few years we have to get new grills for our rental cabins. so I put together a lot of grills. So difficult. Unnecessarily difficult. ON top of it , this grill is such thin material if it lasts half our summer season i will be shocked. The little char broil round grill is my favorite and its not hard to assemble. This took me and another skilled person 4 hours. Crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Robertson

customer_reviews.title: This is truly a quality made and engineered product
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was a little time consuming but was straight forward, easy to do with clear and concise instructions. And amazingly ALL the parts were there. We have used it a number of times and there are no complaints. The price was fair (of course I got it on sale) and knowing what I know now I would purchase this item again. I believe it will last a long time. Thanks for asking, Rembrandt
customer_reviews.author: Rembrandt

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is very difficult for one person.
customer_reviews.text: It's a $100 grill. Can't expect much. Very thin firebox won't last long. BUT OMG... the assembly was a nightmare. If you don't have a helper to hold stuff while you assemble the base, think twice. Once you get the base, it's fairly smooth sailing. It took me a good four hours to assemble. The instructions have NO WORDS just drawings. I ended up with four extra screws.
customer_reviews.author: Markazon Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great price but has drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This thing is flimsy and does not move around easily with a tank of propane attached. It's got a small grilling surface and the lighter died on it a week after I purchased it. I just use a lighter to light it up manually now. This is the 2nd one I've owned and I can say if you can get around the cheapness these do last forever. I had my 1st for 2.5 years in Oregon. It sat outside in the rain and humidity all year. I then replaced it with a series of higher cost/quality grills which all died in a year or less. For the price its worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Instructions with no explanation
customer_reviews.text: Bought the grill, followed every direction and the grill still won't light. We've looked up every single troubleshooting possibility and the grill still won't light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worse grill. It makes your food taste funny because of the cheap coating they have on the inside. All food sticks to the grill as well. As you can see, the coating has burned off onto the top of the grill. I don’t even want to think about all the the chemicals that went into my body from the food i grilled on here.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill! Don’t let bad assembly reviews sway you.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and was a little afraid of assembly. Not even close to what all the reviews complained about. All the screws and bolts are sectioned off perfectly for easy step by step assembly. The pictorial instructions were pretty straight forward. The great piece of advice I got from the reviews, taping the legs during the assembly, was essential. I tried the first side without doing this and realized it was necessary if I wanted a frustration free experience. It made the whole job a breeze. It’s a great little grill. I’m a first time gas griller and I wasn’t disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TLow

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL...
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I left a bad review. But I take it back. I actually managed to put it together on my own. The first time I tried, I was exhausted and just got home from work. Then next night, with a clear head and a couple of brain cells... I completed the installation. Tested it out this evening. People commenting about how it took a whole day? Took me an hour with some clever thinking. The only thing I think that should change is the type of grill plate. It's a bit flimsy, maybe a nice cast iron plate would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan Thane

customer_reviews.title: Gas flame very low on one burner, does not work on the other.
customer_reviews.text: I have crippled through the summer with this gas grill. I could live with just one burner. However, the fact that the flame on the one working burner is so very low, that I cannot get a good sear on steaks. I will probably put this out for the trash in the next few months and buy another grill. Someone will pick it up and maybe they can fix this so it works properly. I am tired of the failed cookouts.
customer_reviews.author: Dartmouth Review

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Pays to look at used items.
customer_reviews.text: This was an open box deal. It was exactly as described and a great price. It was boxed great, new and not missing any parts. I had the same charbroil grille previously for 7 years and instead of replacing the burner decided to purchase a new grille. I looked under used which was an open box deal and figured I would give it a try. It is definitely worth looking at all the deals offered. This was a good experience from Amazon so I am passing the info on.
customer_reviews.author: scott r kasten

customer_reviews.title: Buy it assembled
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Started to assemble and found holes in legs not lining up. Missing part. Boxed this crap up and started the return process. Don't buy this crap. Your better off with a small Weber on a table, or rocks in a circle with a cooking grate and some wood. Wasted an hour trying to identify the parts and another hour boxing it up and the cleaning/vacuuming the crappy styrofoam up. Pain in the arse.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly and Great Grill for the Price!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't go wrong! The reviews that complain about the assembly, well, ignore those if you are mechanically inclined. Take your time and follow the directions and you will have zero issues and be done in about 1 to 1.25 hours. The instructions were clear......just pictures, but clear. Some reviews complain about the second burner not lighting.....well, there is only one igniting side! Light the one side, close the lid and then turn the gas on for the other side....it lights quickly. Overall easy assembly and for the price you can't go wrong! If I get 2 years out of this grill, I will be even more satiafied.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Hog

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This grill sucks...you get what you pay for. We have to push the LOUD AS HELL ignition button no less than 30 times to light it. Our neighbors must thing we're firing off a machine gun. So obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Jaci DeRosso

customer_reviews.title: Junk - look for something else
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for a year. First noticed the top goes back too far. Have to be careful everything i open or close it - or I'll burn my arm. Six months ago the starter stopped working. This is a total waste of money. Look elsewhere for a BBQ.
customer_reviews.author: SalC

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t even assemble
customer_reviews.text: I’ve assembled grills before but this was an absolute nightmare! There were no written instructions, just pictures. I gave up and requested a return.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Linn

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap but it is a grille
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an inexpensive gas grill to use when I didn't want to fire up the Weber kettle.... which I love ! It's cheap, It's flimsy, it doesn't get very hot.... strange, The first time I used it I was grilling some steaks, using an oven thermometer, gas on high... It wouldn't heat over 400 degrees. Cooks hot dogs and chicken just fine. I didn't expect much for a hundred bucks, this grille proved I was right.
customer_reviews.author: amkrs

customer_reviews.title: Pay for the Expert Assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have the patience of Job and the vocabulary of a sailor do not attempt to assemble this yourself. I was a mechanic on a nuclear submarine, and as I put this thing together I used curses I hadn't used in 50 years. I was surprised that I still remembered them all.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapiron

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: After taking 3 hours to build the grill IT DOES NOT WORK. The flam is so low it won’t even cook meat safely. We have a brand new propane tank full and no flame. What a disappointment. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not in the high end barbeque category but if you just want something to cook your hotdogs and chicken legs then this is it. Not too hard to put together. Good value for the money. Make sure you purchase spare burners and heat shields to prolong the life as those are usually the first to go.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Girl

customer_reviews.title: Some assembly required
customer_reviews.text: I have never assembled anything that arrived with so many separate parts. Except for a few words about when to tighten screws, most of the instructions were drawings. Sort of like Ikea assembly. But Ikea never presented such a lenghty assembly. I went at the project pretty diligently and only had to backtrack about ten minutes when I got a couple things upside down. Nevertheless, the project took over two hours. The result was a good sturdy gas grill. It seems to work fine. The Amazon listing offer expert assembly for $75. I would want a lot more than $75 to assemble one of these.
customer_reviews.author: rblaw

customer_reviews.title: It makes job done!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy I got this grill. The main thing - it makes the job done. I spent couple hours assembling it, wasn't that easy, but instructions were ok. I miss two things here: thermometer and upper rack. But for the price - it's pretty damn good. Especially, when you add some wooden chips. Feels like charcoal grill.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The grill was easy to build, it's possible for one person to do but of course it'll be easier with two or even three. The grill worked right away with no issues. It's very convenient, easy to move, and perfect for any household. The instructions are very easy to comprehend. When the box arrived at our front door, there was a "heavy" sticker on it, there were no missing pieces. The hardware comes packaged very precise, each section is labeled and numbered.
customer_reviews.author: Warnali

customer_reviews.title: NOT EASY TO PUT TOGETHER
customer_reviews.text: This grill was an absolute nightmare to put together. Yes, I did carefully read instructions. Maybe hiring a technical writer to write the assembly instructions would be helpful. Could not get wheels on right, so it doesn't roll right. The grill is usable now but seems to not get hot enough. I've owned other Char-Broil grills in past and have been very happy with them. I do not like to write negative reviews but wanted to warn others that assembly is a challenge!
customer_reviews.author: minnie58

customer_reviews.title: Good Grill
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my new grill at my vacation home. It doesn't measure up to my Weber but for the cost of it, it is a good grill. Only complaint is that it comes with no hooks to hand grill tools on. Drilling four hoes in the side shelfs and inserting s-hooks solved that problem. I would recomend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jack L. Haskins

customer_reviews.title: It grills food!
customer_reviews.text: As many have said, it's a bit awkward when you start putting it together. Not impossible by yourself, but would be helpful with a 2nd set of hands. That being said, I picked this grill up on Amazon for $83 (including tax/no side burner) and I've used it once. I love it! It grills food! What more do you need! If you have a small space, have the patience to put it together and you're tight on funds, then this grill is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wayne Turner

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible. The metal doesn't match up right
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. The metal doesn't match up right. Extremely confusing and difficult to put together. I am returning and just buying one from lowes
customer_reviews.author: Epstein didnt kill himself

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is that the distance between the two burners and the tray can’t be adjusted, you can definitely lower the flame but sometimes not enough and the meat can get burn. You can move the meat to the side but been a small grill there is not enough space.
customer_reviews.author: Ana M

customer_reviews.title: waste of money, shouldn't have gotten the one star, but had to to send this !!~
customer_reviews.text: was totally disappointed. I have owned many Char Broil grills in my life but this one was a piece of garbage. One side of the burners would not lite. Called a totaled of 6 time to char Broil, followed every instruction I was told, finally the second burner did ignite-by the knob inside ,ot the burner!!! Was told by the representative I could take it apart and send it back but not refund would be granted due to the fact once it was taken apart to ship back they wouldn't be abel to find the problem !!! instead of wasting any more time and being rudely treated, The trash got a brand new grill !!!
customer_reviews.author: lynda

customer_reviews.title: Terrible to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: The price is right, and the grill functions decently as a basic, small grill. This issue is purely with assembly: several peices did not have correctly punched holes, requiring drilling holes in the correct spots. In numerous cases the instructions were just plain WRONG! The biggest issue is that it seems this grill is packaged in such a way as to require much more assembly than could be required, if better planning and a slightly larger box had been allocated. Overall, assembly was on the order of 3 hours, including drilling, but not including the trip to the hardware store to get washers.
customer_reviews.author: B. Braun

customer_reviews.title: Decent grill for the price and assm. not so hard
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is actually not to bad, I was able to put this together in about one hour using a screwdriver and normal pliers. After reading some reviews about difficult assembly I was wondering if it would be a pain but it was fine. It started right away, got hot fast and had no leaks- What else could I ask for ?
customer_reviews.author: odiehead

customer_reviews.title: 2 hour assembly challenge
customer_reviews.text: This grill had a lot of parts. Putting them together is relatively simple but if you don't have the magic of levitation I suggest you get an extra set of hands to help. The grill isn't too big doesn't take up too much space and gets pretty hot hot enough to put a nice tan sear on meat. An excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Swamprat_SRQ

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill,
customer_reviews.text: Love this little grill, perfect for my small family of three. Took me a while to put it together but once started it went quite quickly. Cooks great, grills great we do a lot of grilled veggies and everything comes out tasting awesome, I bought this based on buyer reviews and I’m glad I did, I was not paid to write this and I am not part of any promotional program.
customer_reviews.author: Saoirse

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed there isn't a top rack. I probably wouldn't have purchased if I had realized. Overall it's a nice little grill, perfect for my husband and I. I assembled it myself in just a couple hours. The instructions could have been better (words would have been nice) but they weren't so bad as to pay for someone else to assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Small

customer_reviews.title: Great grill, a little tricky to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once, but love it so far. The first few assembly steps are really tricky unless you have help. I didn't, so I used some plastic moving wrap to stabilize the legs. After that, easy peasy. I just removed the wrap as I got to the steps that screwed into the legs. It doesn't come with the tools you need so be prepared with a screwdriver and wrenches. So far it seems perfect for me, a first time grill buyer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dargavel

customer_reviews.title: Love it! It does not have all the bells ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It does not have all the bells and whistles (which I do not use enough to justify) of the others, but the price is 1/6 the price of the others and will buy another one of these in two years when it falls apart as the others in the same amount of time. Plus this one is much more light weight and rolls so much easier to move from different areas of the patio. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: joanniet

customer_reviews.title: Small budget friendly gas grill
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't the easiest thing to assemble, but it wasn't impossible either. But now that it's together, it works well. It is on the small side, but it's just 2 of us in our house, so we don't need anything really big. We were able to grill 12 hamburgers on it at the same time - they were snug, but we were able to do it. It is budget friendly and that's the best part!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stein

customer_reviews.title: Husband hates but.....
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this little guy thinking "it's great, for the price we can order a new one every year and it'll be the same as paying $500 for one that will only last about 5 years"! Haha! He hates it! But..... my daughter and I love it! It's perfect for our family of three and doesn't take up too much room. Functions as it should! :)
customer_reviews.author: KWS

customer_reviews.title: What kind of assembly "directions" are these??? ...
customer_reviews.text: What kind of assembly "directions" are these??? Just pictures with references to fasteners. It took me twice as long as it would have with written instructions. The grill is what I expected for the price I paid. It compliments my charcoal grill for when a quick meal is necessary and the charcoal wouldn't have time to build the proper temperature. Does anyone know what the hanging chain is for off the one side stand???? I'm baffled by it.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It takes about a night to assemble. The directions are not the easiest. But once it is together it works great. Love it for the price. The hot spot is in the center. I use it one average 3 times a week. We live in a condo with a deck above us. It does not get too hot. It is small enough for our living situation but large enough to fit a meat for six if needed.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: What a bargain
customer_reviews.text: The assembly is relatively involved. The buyer is essentially assembling the whole thing -- you just get a bunch of parts in a box. But that's ok by me. It's a great grill and I'm mechanically inclined, so I'd rather save a whole bunch and have the fun of putting it together. How can you beat $89 for this? Fantastic buy.
customer_reviews.author: B. Engle

customer_reviews.title: Holes drilled in wrong place. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Char broil has been my choice of bbq grills for many years. Unfortunately the leg on the bbq has the holes drilled in the wrong place. Ugh, i am having a neighbor drill a new hole to make it work. Don’t want to go through hassle of returning the grill. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: KATHERINE A. LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit because of price. It was less expensive than most and I will use it mainly on my camper. It has a good even heat is big enough to get 4 good sized rib eyes on the grill. I cooked these steaks slowly and they were perfect. The grill really surprised me. Not a good buy but a great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good grill for the price.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My fiance and I were able to put together the grill in less than an hour (about 52 mins to be exact). All you need is a screw driver and a wrench. The instructions were fine. I'm not sure what the hassle everyone is having with it. Dropped in a propane tank on Monday and have grilled chicken and burgers so far. I'm very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Fortinbras of Norway

customer_reviews.title: What I expected.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was a bit nervous about assembly. I took my time and matched everything up as the pictures showed. I was able to assemble it by myself with no problems. I havent cooked with it yet, but the quality seems good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Good grill... be patient with assembly
customer_reviews.text: I knew looking at other reviews that this would be an Ikea style assembly, and that's exactly what I got. The instructions were decent, but I had to sit at a couple of pages to really understand the pictures. I didn't have any missing parts. There was only one assembly of adding a metal plate underneath where the angle was very difficult to deal with. Fortunately, I've assembled plenty of Ikea furniture, so I'm used to this. Once assembled, it looks nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small space.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good small grill. It wasn’t too difficult to assemble and has been working well since I got it. I keep it on my balcony which is not huge and it’s the perfect size. I’ve found that it does need to be cleaned out a bit more frequently than larger grills but it’s not like you need to do it with every use. After I made burgers and then bbq chicken I did get a lot of flame up from the old grease catching fire. Since it’s small it is easy to clean out every couple uses and this hasn’t been an issue since.
customer_reviews.author: ethan

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO PUT TOGETHER UNLESS YOU HAVE 3 EXTRA HANDS
customer_reviews.text: My dad and I set this up. The instructions are unclear, and it would be VERY DIFFICULT to put together alone. Works well once assembled, though that is outweighed by the difficulty to move it, and put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Still Going Strong After A Year!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grill a year ago and it is still going strong! I live in an apartment so space saving is a plus! This grill wheels around nicely and fits up against my patio side wall when not in use. This grill is also great on gas! I use it a few times a week and only need to get gas every two months or so
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Ramstetter

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes you really do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice size for my apartment balcony. Fits more food than expected. Easy to clean grates. Cons: I didn't assemble myself but those instructions seem impossible. Ignition switch stopped working soon after purchase. Forget using this on windy days-wind blew behind grill & sent flames behind the knobs therefore melting both of them.
customer_reviews.author: BRENDA K LEDFORD

customer_reviews.title: Nice little grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little grill. Takes some patients and close attention to the picture instructions, but well worth the effort. Give yourself plenty of work space and familiarize your self with the instructions before starting assembly. My only disappointment was for some reason I thought it had a warming rack which it does not. No big deal neither did my last grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C

customer_reviews.title: Patience is your friend when assembling this little thing!
customer_reviews.text: It is a time consuming process to assemble. Took me about 2 hours. Instructions are good but very cryptic. The pieces are NOT numbered or labeled which makes it more difficult than it should be so you really need to pay attention to the details in the photos. A socket wrench and power screwdriver will make it go much quicker and easier. Nice little grill!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lenzmeier

customer_reviews.title: Poor package instructions
customer_reviews.text: Poor package instructions. Poorly labeled parts. There is a big card with multiple screws, nuts and fasteners, BUT no legend or number system for the the hardware. what a pain to assemble. Next time I purchasing one from a home improvement center.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Look for a different grill!
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's ok but with 2 burners, it doesnt get the grill very hot. Also the instructions to put it together were terrible and took forever! Had I not assembled it and unpacked it, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it works better than ny more expensive one I used to have. Dependable, cooks great, dont need all the fancy stuff to make a good bbq.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This grill may look little, but it is exactly what we need. It will grill 12 hamburgers, easily. Probably more if I needed. It cleans like a charm. A little cumbersome to assemble for two 75 year olds, but works great!! I recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: grannySue

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and functional
customer_reviews.text: You need to be prepared to dedicate a decent portion of an afternoon for 2 people to put it together, but it's great from there on!
customer_reviews.author: RainaMC

customer_reviews.title: Grill works fine. The structure support failed.
customer_reviews.text: The grill works fine for simple cook outs. The support brace on the back side had a weld fail. It is almost impossible to move the grill with a loaded propane tank mounted on the grill. The support brace will require rewelding or additional bracing. I also installed a temperature gauge for my convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Scott

customer_reviews.title: A fine product if you have the patients to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: The grill was a challenge for my wife and I to assemble. If you aren’t mechanically adept you may want to move on to another product or buy one pre-assembled at Walmart. But I think the assembled product is worth the effort. I grilled lamb chops the first night and my wife loved them. IKEA furniture is what my wife says you need to be pre-qualified. Time will tell wether or not it was a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyH

customer_reviews.title: Pain to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Other than it is a pain to assemble,It is a well built good little grill. Had one like it for years, and parts are available if it needs any repair in the future
customer_reviews.author: Richard Srader

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: This was in no way easy to assemble. The bolts and screwes on the legs got stuck for some reason and i they just never tightened. Even now, i have wobbly legs. Still works though
customer_reviews.author: Betzaida Rueda

customer_reviews.title: Grill está bien
customer_reviews.text: Fully assembled in under 1.5 hrs, awaiting engineering associates degree, by correspondence, from Charbroil now. Also, does in fact cook meat with proper propane supply (sadly not included).
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little grill for a single person or a apartment
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little grill for a single person or a apartment. I have used it extensively since I bought it a couple weeks ago. Cooks the food perfectly. Now it isn't as sturdy as more expensive grills but for the price it is very good. Just take care of it and keep it clean and it should last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Micha S

customer_reviews.title: Pretty straight forward assembly if you have ever put anything ...
customer_reviews.text: I saw the reviews say it will take over 3 hours to assemble...CHALLENGE ACCEPTED. I took out all the parts and set my timer. It took me one hour and thirty four minutes. Pretty straight forward assembly if you have ever put anything together in your entire life. Works great and gets the job done. Perfect grill for our little apartment balcony.
customer_reviews.author: JBLJL

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Good bang for your buck. Light weight easy to operate. Assembly isn’t quite as simple as you’re led to believe and there were leftover parts which is a little scary. But so far so good; I’ve used it twice and I’m pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Clason

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the other reviews fool you, assembly was simple. Single handedly completed in two hours. If you can follow pictures, your fine. Grill itself is simple. Works fine and no complaints for a standard two burner grill.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roll

customer_reviews.title: Instructions suck!
customer_reviews.text: The grill is worth money but putting it together isn't so simple. The directions are diagrams that are not really clear, at least to me. It would have been easier with written instructions as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny L.

customer_reviews.title: Bugger to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Someone posted you need 3 arms and one should be 4 foot long,I agree.Took me 2 hours to assemble.All the parts and hardware were there.It is a good grill but be ready to do some cussin.😜😜
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This little grill works better than I expected it to. It's easy to move it around the deck because of the wheels. It did take some time to assemble, but well worth the extra effort!
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Great grill— terrible assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Worst assembly instructions we’ve ever read. Great grill once you finally get it assembled (If you don’t lose your mind trying).
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Looked like alot of work, but alone listening to music my husband put it together under 80 min. Haven't used it. Looks sturdy. The electric spark wire seemed loose and bent where it originated so he used black tape to reinforce it
customer_reviews.author: happy wife

customer_reviews.title: Essembly is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Parts don't fit right together. Instructions are vague. Have yet to get it even remotely started to be put together after 45 minutes
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to put together, the instructions are an exploded view, and there is more than one way to fit things together. Once built it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Maddux

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive BBQ
customer_reviews.text: After having a Weber for 20 years, I wanted a nice inexpensive BBQ - it is just me now. I was surprised at how much heat radiated from this one. I actually burned the first thing I cooked. Now that I am more familiar with the heat - it is a great way to cook food.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Withrow

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made, instructions poorly written, missing a couple of parts and too many of others. Next time I will buy a different brand and in any case will buy locally and have it assembled at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good price for great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to build, to use and to clean! The fact that we got such a nice grill, for a good price is my favorite part about it.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Plan on a couple of hours to assemble. Pay ...
customer_reviews.text: Plan on a couple of hours to assemble. Pay very careful attention to the pictures. Assemble in a clean area and do not loose any parts, there are no spares. You will on need a screwdriver and an 8mm wrench.
customer_reviews.author: NGC 46

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to assemble by myself but after it was done the grill works good so far. Looks attractive and is exactly the size I need.
customer_reviews.author: tinamob

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Bad instructions. No words just pictures. Grill grates came with pieces chipped off the coating. It's a decent cheap little grill.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Good budget grill.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grill for about two months now. It was easy to put together and the only issue I had was that I had to drill a small hole to connect the lid of the grill. I wouldn't let that deter you from buying it though. I doubt every grill has this issue. I would recommend this grill to anyone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Son of Greer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, hard to put together
customer_reviews.text: It is small, so it burns food if you don't keep an eye on it or put the meat in the right places. Seems like the left side burns hotter, but if you adjust it and such, it's great! Fits perfectly on our small apartment porch. Was kind of hard to put together though, that's why it loses a star, my boyfriend was super frustrated putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is crazy.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was rough, this is the second grill I’ve assembled and this was more work than it should’ve been, you literally make the grill...you have to install and connect burners. Also, pieces don’t easily go together, you have to wrestle it a bit. Once it’s together it’s a good grill.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas shamah

product_meta.title: Char-Broil Classic 280 2-Burner Liquid Propane Gas Grill
product_meta.description: Style:Without Side BurnerThe Char-Broil classic 2B 280 is a two burner gas grill that delivers 20,000 BTU's of heat & a 280 square" cooking surface to accomodate large meals with ease. The primary cooking surface measures" wide x" deep, for a total of 280 square" of cooking space. The grates are porcelain-coated, making them rust-resistant & easy to both cook on & clean. The classic 280 offers 2 metal side shelves, which are durable & provide much needed work & prep space, each measuring" wide x" deep. The grills sits on two fixed' & two 6-inch wheels, for both portability & stability. Features piezo ignition for fast & reliable startups, & in-line stainless steel burners which are built to last. The steel lid & firebox are both porcelain-coated, making the Char-Broil classic 280 capable of withstanding the weather & elements.Assembled Dimensions(inches): 16.9 x 17.7 x 26
feature_bullets: 280 square inches of cooking space over porcelain-coated grates
Two stainless steel in-line burners for cooking performance;Assembly Required
Porcelain-coated steel lid and firebox stand up to weather and the elements
Metal side shelves measure 12-inches w x 13-inches l providing extra storage and prep space
Piezo ignition system for fast and reliable startups. Cooking System: Convectional

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,180 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
